{"step_by_step_thinking": "The brachial plexus is divided into roots, trunks, divisions, cords, and branches. According to the documents, roots give rise to trunks, trunks divide into divisions, divisions form cords, and cords give rise to branches. Therefore, the part of the brachial plexus that does not give branches is the division.", "answer_choice": "B. Division"}
